intro: Hieracium comatuloides, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads made up of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium comatuloides is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
